intro: Galium mexicanum subsp. mexicanum, commonly known as Mexican bedstraw, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers in clusters during the spring and summer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and rocky slopes. Its botanical features make it an important component of native plant communities in its habitat.
